IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To promote and advance artistic and cultural development through education in a beautiful, natural environment conducive to positive personal growth.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Idyllwild Arts Foundation was formed to promote and advance artistic and cultural development through education in a beautiful, natural environment conducive to positive personal growth.
IRS990.Description: Idyllwild Arts Academy: Fully accredited boarding high school for students who are talented in the arts, which offers pre-professional training in the arts and preparatory academic studies.

Activity2.Description: Idyllwild Summer Program: An accredited summer program which includes 115 art courses over eight weeks for all ages.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Through December 31, 2008, the California Uniform Management of Institutional Funds Act (UMIFA) governed the management and use of donor-restricted endowment funds held by charitable institutions in the state of California. Under UMIFA, the School classified as permanently restricted net assets the original value of gifts donated to the permanent endowment and accumulations to the permanent endowment made in accordance with the direction, if any, of the applicable donor gift instrument. Accumulated earnings of donor-restricted endowment funds are classified as unrestricted or temporarily restricted net assets, funds available for operations in accordance with the donor specifications.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: In July 2006, the Financial Accounting Standards Board ("FASB") issued Financial Accounting Standards Interpretation No. 48 ("FIN 48"), Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes, now referred to as Accounting Standards Codification 740 ("ASC 740"), which clarifies the accounting for uncertainty in income tax positions taken or expected to be taken in tax returns that affect amounts reported in an organization's financial statements in accordance with the Accounting for Income Taxes Topic of ASC 740 (formerly SFAS 109, Accounting for Income Taxes). ASC 740 requires that an organization recognize in the financial statements the impact of the tax position if that position will more likely than not be sustained on audit, based on the technical merits of the position. ASC 740 also provides guidance related to de-recognition, classification, interest and penalties, accounting in interim periods and disclosure. During the year ended June 30, 2010, the School performed an evaluation of uncertain tax positions and did not note any matters that would require recognition in the statement of activities or which may have an effect on its tax-exempt status.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: LEGENDS IN PROMOTIONAL AND ADMISSIONS MATERIALS

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: IDYLLWILD ARTS IS NOT ENGAGED IN GRANTMAKING; ALL RECIPIENTS OF ASSISTANCE ARE STUDENTS WHO ARE MONITORED THROUGH THEIR ENROLLMENT IN THE SCHOOL'S PROGRAMS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The following officers, trustees, directors, or key employees have family relationships: 1) William and Susan Barnett (Husband and Wife) 2) Rich and Rachel Fishbein (Husband and Wife) 3) Richard and Janet Goldberg (Husband and Wife) 4) James and Lillian Lovelace (Husband and Wife) 5) Mike and Eadie Ferretti (Husband and Wife) 6) William and Carolyn Lowman (Husband and Wife)

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization's board of trustees vote to elect the board of governors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The audit committee reviews the tax return prepared by the outside accountants. Once approved by the audit committee, the form is made available to the entire Board of GOVERNORS. HOWEVER, SCHEDULE B IS EXCLUDED FROM THE COPY PROVIDED TO THE FULL BOARD, AND THEREFORE, THE ORGANIZATION CHECKED THE NO BOX ON PART VI SECTION B LINE 11. The return is then electronically filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Each officer, director, or trustee is required to complete and submit a disclosure annually.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CEO compensation is determined by A Compensation Committee of the Board of Governors and approved by the Board of Governors. Other key employee compensation is determined through the budget process and the budget is approved by the Board of Governors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Idyllwild Arts Foundation makes their Form 1023, Form 990 available to the public through our public website, www.IDYLLWiLDARTS.ORG, and through www.guidestar.org, a public website. They are also made available to the public upon written request.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Idyllwild Arts Foundation makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, financial statements, and informational returns available to the public through our public website, www.IDYLLWiLDARTS.ORG, and through www.guidestar.org, a public website. The informational returns are also made available to the public upon written request.
